> Shane is referring to the singleton design pattern. You should really buy
> "Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software" by Erich
> Gamma, et al.  Amazon has a deal where you can get the refactoring book by
> Martin Fowler at the same time -- also an excellent book. Both are
> prerequisite reading on this newsgroup.

...and then you should read my article on IBM DeveloperWorks about Singleton
and when you should avoid it. I'm not saying, "Don't use it," but when a
programmer gets hold of a design pattern, he turns that pattern into a
hammer and everything else becomes a nail. :)

http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/co-single.html

Thanks. By the way, if you buy the Design Patterns CD, you get the whole
book in hypertext. I preferred that, myself. I do not own a paper copy.

JBR.
